tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE user_interactions (
  interaction_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id INT,
  device_id INT,
  interaction_type VARCHAR(50),
  interaction_timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE devices (
    device_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name VARCHAR(255),
    device_type VARCHAR(50),
    location_id INT,
    last_interaction TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE interactions (
    interaction_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT,
    user_id INT,
    interaction_type VARCHAR(50),
    interaction_date TIMESTAMP,
    interaction_duration INT
);

CREATE TABLE interaction_logs (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    device_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    interaction_type VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE maintenance_history (
    history_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    maintenance_type VARCHAR(50),
    technician_id INT
);
CREATE TABLE User (id UUID PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, email VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL, last_interaction TIMESTAMP NOT NULL);
CREATE TABLE Device (id UUID PRIMARY KEY, device_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, location VARCHAR(100), last maintenance TIMESTAMP);

CREATE TABLE Interaction (id UUID PRIMARY KEY, user_id UUID REFERENCES User(id), device_id UUID REFERENCES Device(id), interaction_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, interaction_timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL);
CREATE TABLE MaintenanceLog (id UUID PRIMARY KEY, device_id UUID REFERENCES Device(id), maintenance_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, maintenance_timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL);
CREATE TABLE PredictiveMaintenance (id UUID PRIMARY KEY, device_id UUID REFERENCES Device(id), prediction_score FLOAT, predicted_maintenance_timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL);
